misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the increment section of a for loop can modify any variable, and that the loop will still progress correctly. They may have confused which variable needs to be incremented, or thought that incrementing the outer loop variable inside the inner loop would help control the inner loop's progression.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student does not understand that a for loop's increment section must modify the same variable referenced in the loop condition to make the loop progress toward termination. When a different variable is incremented, the condition's control variable never changes, causing an infinite loop. The student appears to conflate the role of the loop control variable with other variables.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: Infinite loop: the program will hang when it reaches the inner loop, because currentStarCount is never incremented and will always satisfy the condition currentStarCount <= currentRowNumber, while currentRowNumber (the wrong variable) gets incremented indefinitely.
